document_info.title: Question about Acidification and Basification - Extraction Technique Discussion
document_info.purpose: Discussion on when and why to apply heat during A/B extraction
document_info.disclaimer: Educational reference only. Documents historical extraction chemistry discussions.

original_question.context: Reading all teks, taking notes, comparing Vovin's tek and Cyb's Max Ion

cell_lysis_already_done: Acidic cook breaks down plant proteins (increases ionic strength per CTM)
reasoning.concern: Heating during basification seems like overkill and unnecessary

original_question.hypothesis: Heat should only be applied during acidifying and solvent pulling

base_step.step_4: Dissolve ~40g NaOH in ~100ml cool filtered water, add to acidic/saline mix
base_step.step_5: Warm mix in heat bath for 2 hours (stir occasionally)
base_step.note: Low heat - glass vessel should be handleable without burning
base_step.step_6: After 2 hours, cool to room temperature

pete666.on_heating_during_basification: I don't see any reason why you should warm it up at that stage too
pete666.acid_boils_clarification: No need to use heatbath for acid boils. Acid boils = Boiling RB/water/acid together
pete666.on_heated_pulls: My experience is I get more with heated pull than with cold one. Based on titration, not weight - so very likely mostly alkaloids
pete666.stb_note: In STB, basification is the ONLY cell lysis method - works flawlessly but lye concentration is much higher

psilosopher.method: Keep entire process at 60C from acidification to solvent pulling

rationale.brownian_motion: More heat = more Brownian motion = more molecular collision = hastened reaction rate
rationale.overkill_philosophy: Overkill is better than no kill
rationale.cell_lysis_uncertainty: No guarantee every cell lysed from freeze/thaw or acid cook
rationale.basification_effect: Basification reduces even semi-solid strips of bark into sludgy mess

on_fats_and_oils.perspective: I WANT more oils and fats - gives experience living plant energy
on_fats_and_oils.pure_white_opinion: Pure white xtals are very mechanical and alien - still cool but acquired taste
on_fats_and_oils.cleanup_option: If wanted clean white xtals, could always do mini A/B

freebase_mechanism.understanding: Freebase DMT is NOT dissolved in base solution - merely suspended, floating free
freebase_mechanism.solvent_interaction: Moment it contacts NPS, it jumps ship into more preferable solvent
freebase_mechanism.heat_benefit: More heat = more chances for DMT to jump ship into solvent

experimental_comparison.warm_vs_cold: Warm pulls have ALWAYS yielded more
experimental_comparison.effort_note: Even putting more effort into cold pull, still yielded much less
experimental_comparison.caveat: Extra yield in warm pulls could be just oils/fats

on_technique_quality.massive_difference: Massive difference between shoddy technique and proper methodology
on_technique_quality.shoddy_defined: Skipping 'optional' steps or doing steps half-arsed
on_technique_quality.trip_quality: When rushed or bad technique, trips were nonsensical or patronising
on_technique_quality.dmt_feedback: DMT like disappointed parent: 'Both you and i could do so much more than this'

on_60c_process.concern: Bet you pull more oils/fats and unwanted material
on_60c_process.ctm_reference: CTM suggests 70C for hours if using heat to break down plant proteins for ionic strength

on_solubility_physics.principle: Solutes are more soluble in heated solvents (water/nonpolar)
on_solubility_physics.implication: Heating both layers might not give most saturated pulls - DMT more soluble in BOTH liquids
on_solubility_physics.alternative: Can use more water to compensate for heat

heat_application_analysis.only_benefit_seen: Faster separation of layers and pulling more stuff (fats/oils)
heat_application_analysis.prediction: Difference in DMT pulled with heat on both layers vs only heated nonpolar won't be dramatic
heat_application_analysis.concern: More cleaning steps later to remove oils

processing_already_done: Bark sliced to powder in high speed, beaten to dust
All done over hours and hours
cell_lysis_overkill_argument.conclusion: Makes no sense to contaminate final product with fats/oils and waste time on multiple cleaning steps

saturation_theory.reasoning: Heating both layers = alkaloids + fats/oils + coloring
saturation_theory.problem: Could guess solvent is saturated based on color (from fats/oils) and pull before actual saturation
saturation_theory.result: Reduction of DMT in solvent PER PULL

proposed_optimal_method.heat_only: Only heat the nonpolar (room temp basic AQ layer)
benefits: No wasted time/energy on water heatbath

ph_terminology_clarification.pete666_point: pH 12 is low compared to pH 14 - STB uses much higher concentration of lye
ph_terminology_clarification.context: Discussing relative pH levels and their effect on plant material disintegration

heat_during_basification.pro: More Brownian motion, better cell lysis, bark turns to sludge
heat_during_basification.con: May be unnecessary if powder used and proper acid cook done
heat_during_basification.consensus: No clear scientific reason found in discussion

warm_vs_cold_pulls.titration_evidence: pete666 confirmed via titration - mostly alkaloids
warm_vs_cold_pulls.caveat: Some extra yield may be oils/fats

technique_vs_shortcuts.experiential_aspect: Trip quality correlates with extraction care taken

personal_preference.full_spectrum: Psilosopher prefers oils/fats for 'living plant energy'
personal_preference.pure_crystals: Th Entity prefers purity to avoid cleaning steps

terminology.acid_boils: Boiling root bark + water + acid together (NOT just heatbath)
terminology.STB: Straight To Base - no acid step, direct basification
terminology.A_B: Acid/Base extraction - acid soak then basification
terminology.ionic_strength: Concentration of ions in solution - affects extraction efficiency
terminology.cell_lysis: Breaking open plant cells to release contents
terminology.freebase: Non-salt form of alkaloid - not water soluble, soluble in NPS
terminology.mini_A_B: Small-scale acid/base cleanup to purify product

heat_applications.during_acidification: Recommended - breaks down plant proteins, lyses cells
heat_applications.during_basification: Debatable - may help with non-powdered material
heat_applications.during_solvent_pulls: Recommended - consensus that warm pulls yield more

material_preparation.if_shredded: More aggressive technique needed (heat during basification helps)

final_thoughts.th_entity_conclusion: DMT is like life in every aspect - from extracting to smoking to experience - it's all perspective, different for everyone
final_thoughts.takeaway: Whatever works for the individual - both approaches valid
